events.message: Customer submitted the initial claim following a vehicle collision on the highway resulting in significant front-end damage.
Claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident cluster based on incident description involving the customer's car.
An experienced agent was assigned to handle the auto accident claim promptly to ensure quick assistance.
The customer received formal acknowledgment of the claim filing along with information on next steps.
Request sent to customer for submitting police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and repair estimates.
Customer provided all requested documents, including detailed images of the car damage and official police report.
Claim investigation began to verify the accident circumstances and validate submitted evidence.
Investigation confirmed fault determination and assessment of repair cost was completed successfully.
A settlement offer was proposed to the customer covering the repair expenses and associated costs.
Customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and appreciated the timely claims process.
Claim was officially approved by the insurance department after customer's acceptance of the settlement offer.
Payment for the approved claim was processed and sent to the customer's designated bank account.
The claim file was closed following successful payment issuance and no further action required.
All claim documents and correspondence were archived as per company policy for future reference if needed.
